ActivityObject

A noun-ish thing in the activity universe

The activity streams spec talks about activity objects, while also having a tag activity:object, which is in fact an activity object.  Aaaaaah!

This is just a thing in the activity universe.  Can be the subject, object, or indirect object (target!) of an activity verb.  Rotten name, and we’re propagating it.  sigh

Defines

Constants for the schemas

  • ARTICLE - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/article’;
  • BLOGENTRY - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/blog-entry’;
  • NOTE - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/note’;
  • STATUS - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/status’;
  • FILE - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/file’;
  • PHOTO - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/photo’;
  • ALBUM - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/photo-album’;
  • PLAYLIST - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/playlist’;
  • VIDEO - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/video’;
  • AUDIO - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/audio’;
  • BOOKMARK - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/bookmark’;
  • PERSON - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/person’;
  • GROUP - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/group’;
  • _LIST - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/list’; // LIST is reserved
  • PLACE - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/place’;
  • COMMENT - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/comment’;
  • ACTIVITY - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/activity’;
  • SERVICE - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/service’;
  • IMAGE - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/image’;
  • COLLECTION - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/collection’;
  • APPLICATION - ‘http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/application’;

ATOM feed bits we look for

  • TITLE - ‘title’;
  • SUMMARY - ‘summary’;
  • ID - ‘id’;
  • SOURCE - ‘source’;
  • NAME - ‘name’;
  • URI - ‘uri’;
  • EMAIL - ‘email’;

Posterous stuff

  • POSTEROUS - ‘http://posterous.com/help/rss/1.0’;
  • AUTHOR - ‘author’;
  • USERIMAGE - ‘userImage’;
  • PROFILEURL - ‘profileUrl’;
  • NICKNAME - ‘nickName’;
  • DISPLAYNAME - ‘displayName’;
